result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerome Lamar Sims was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample; pay related surcharge. Pay court costs and victim/witness surcharges by 07-21-17; non-payment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
- Restitution is set at zero.

Consecutive to: Any other sentence; Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work, AODA treatment, child care, work crew, school. Court takes no stance on electronic monitoring and finds the defendant eligible for the Day Reporting Center. Sentence to commence FORTHWITH. Defendant remanded into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerome Lamar Sims

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jerome Lamar Sims
Current: 2744 N. 53rd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210 United States  (Effective: 07-24-2017)
Prior: 3021 N. 45th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statements by: Martell H. 
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 10 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 3 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply`for work, AODA treatment, child care, work crew, school.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 7/21/17; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 7/21/17; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution set at zero
Court takes no stance on electronic monitoring and finds the defendant eligible for the day reporting center.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Sentence to commence FORTHWITH. Defendant remanded to the custody of the Milwaukee Count Sheriff.
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Jerome Lamar Sims in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Jerome Lamar Sims in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for plea/sentencing, however, court is unable to hear this case today.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 15.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jerome Lamar Sims in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court granted defense request. State placed new offer on the record. Case adjourned to branch 15.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jerome Lamar Sims in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defense is still waiting for the defendant's in custody interview. Case calendared for STATUS on 6/9/2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.

Defendant Jerome Lamar Sims in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Nathaniel Adamson for Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Fiorenza.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signature bond that was previously signed to remain. No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription, Oral No Weapons Order  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 05-06-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jerome Lamar Sims in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4-27-2015
